results.title: Charlemagne and his empire
results.brief_description: Pictures Charlemagne’s conquests , his close ties with the Roman Church, his system of government, and his many contributions to life in the Middle Ages. Shows how Charlemagne hoped to keep civilization and culture alive on the European continent during the early years of the Middle Ages. No other credits available.

results.title: Chariots of fire
results.brief_description: Historical drama based on a true story of two members of Britain’s 1924 Olympic team, Harold Abrahams, a Jew running to prove himself in the face of the subtle hostility he found in his British environment, and Eric Liddell, a deeply religious man who refused to run on the Sabbath. Academy Award winner for Best Picture.

results.title: Chardin and the female image (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Kafno, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Examines the paintings of Chardin in relation to the tradition of portraying the female image, and compares his work to that of contemporaries such as Fragonard, Watteau, Boucher and Greuze

results.title: Charade [DVD]
results.brief_description: A Parisienne (Audrey Hepburn) finds her husband murdered. Four strange men are after her, and she is helped by a handsome stranger (Cary Grant)… but is he a hero, spy or a murderer? A mammoth audience teaser bursting with multiple identities, smart Parisian settings and Henry Mancini music. The song Charade was nominated for an Academy Award, lyrics by Johnny Mercier.

results.title: Characteristics and handling of materials
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sewing”.
Shows how to handle various types of materials, including cottons, woollens, silks and such synthetic fabrics as rayons, in preparation for sewing.

results.title: Character make-up: youth & age
results.brief_description: This program deals with character make-up, youth and age. Laura Bradish demonstrates the application of character make-up as a young actress is transformed into an old woman.

results.title: Character - Setting - Plot
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
Writers on Writing is based on a growing archive of video material of contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. This video examines how characters are created, and how important are setting and plot.

group_siblings.title: Beginnings - Inspiration - the Role of the Writer

results.title: Chapter and verse
results.creator_credit: Paul Rotha, Strand Films, National Book Council and Stanley Hawes
results.brief_description: The history of printing is traced from its beginning to modern methods of large scale production in English Publishing Houses and the distribution and marketing of the finished book. At the same time, the film follows the life of an individual book, beginning with the author’s MS, the reading of the proofs, the printing, binding, sale to shops and final use in libraries where it is indexed and catalogued.

results.title: Chaplin: a character is born
results.creator_credit: S-L Film Productions and Gerald A Schiller
results.brief_description: Narrated by Keenan Wynn, this film briefly traces Chaplin’s early life, his days with the Fred Karne vaudeville troupe and his film career up until the time he left Mutual Studios at the end of 1917. Extracts from many of Chaplin’s important early films are shown, including “Making a living” (1914), “Kid auto races at Venice” (1914), “The Vagabond” (1916), “the Pawnshop” (1916), “The Rink” (1916), “Easy Street” (1917), “The Immigrant” (1917) and “The Adventurer” (1917).
results.creator_credit_for_label: S-L Film Productions and Gerald A Schiller
